passages.name: Oracle Service Proposal
passages.text: The proposal is to raise $1 million through restaked ETH to fund the development and deployment of a decentralized oracle service. Contributors will receive a prorated distribution of yield, potential profit-sharing, and the return of their principal at the end of the project.

passages.name: SSV and EigenPods
passages.text: SSV (Secret Shared Validator) technology ensures the security and decentralized management of validators, while EigenPods help allocate restaked ETH to various yield-generating services.

passages.name: Project Structure Overview
passages.text: The project involves restaking 500 ETH through EigenLayer, with milestone-based payments to the contractor over 3 years. The oracle service will generate revenue through service fees, contributing to yield payments.

passages.name: Payment Milestones
passages.text: Payments are made based on the completion of milestones: $200,000 at the end of Year 1, $300,000 at the end of Year 2, and $300,000 at the end of Year 3. A final $200,000 payment is made upon project completion.

passages.name: End of Proposal
passages.text: You now understand the proposal for the decentralized oracle service. Let's move on to the setup for running a validator on the Holesky testnet.
